runs.comm: straight, defended, all very low key
and the same again ... Wright half forward and caught in two minds, neither of them attacking
Pollock on the button, Wright again stifles any attacking urge
half forward, loose drive, the ball loops to cover who takes it above his head at a very gentle pace
full, Pietersen blocks and Pollock fields to his right
pulled off the back foot straight to mid-off
forward and deliberately steered down and to the right of slip, third man fields
sweetly turned from outside off stump through midwicket and the silence is deafening ... whipped with his wrists, super shot into a big space
driven to the man just put there (at midwicket)
he shapes to pull but the ball keeps low and is through him ... loud cheers and Ntini gives a hard stare
angled in, driven stump straight past Ntini and mid-off round to field
Prior stuns the ball into the off side and sets off for a run. Pietersen slow to react - he wanted to keep the strike - but with Prior sprinting towards him, he had to respond
short, played with either soft hands or soft gloves into the on side for an easy single
Pietersen shimmies to the off and whips that behind square to the left of Ntini at  fine leg who was on the edge of the 30-yard circle
slower ball, defended back to Pollock
almost up in the blockhole, dug out to mid-on who is back on the circle, so another ambled run
defended on the walk, Pollock quickly across to the leg side to field
he reaches for a drive to a wide ball, gets a thick edge and the ball bumbles down to third man
Prior fends and misses, shaping to run the ball behind square
short, mistimed pull into the leg side and mid-on round to his right to retrieve
checked drive bounces inches wide of Ntini, a run as the ball trundles up to mid-off
short, pulled again but once more not timed, chased within a foot of the rope by Philander who skips over the rope as he stops it  and skips back to throw it in
firm drive to extra cover, good stop
driven hard, a loud shout of catch but it clears Phinander at mid-on by no more than two or three inches, he was on the edge of the circle as he leapt
tip-and-run play by Prior, dead batted into the covers. Everyone knows he has to give the strike to his team-mate
pushed to Morkel who is the deepest of the three men in the covers

short, pulled behind square with no oomph, Ntini at short fine leg fields and throws down the stumps at the bowler's end ... Pietersen collides with Pollock and is sent sprawling and stumbles into the crease unable to get his bat anywhere near it. He's well short but only because he colided
driven to cover and overthrows result - poor fielding and Pollock is fuming
uncertain shot with minimal footwork which flies right at slip who clings on to a good catch
at leg stump, Shah gets bat and pad onto it, the ball dribbles into the on side
speared down the leg side, Boucher leaps to his left and makes a classy one-handed diving stop
blocked, all very solid, Ntini fields
short, Shah looks to pull it into the ocean but misses, undone by some extra bounce
half volley driven to mid-on
a run a ball is not enough now, but Prior not in great touch
another calculated tip-and-run into the off side but this time to no effect
Shah misses with an attempted drive
dropped into the pitch at his feet, no run
two steps down the pitch, a big heave and he misses by some way
patted into the leg side, at last Prior finds a space
driven off the back foot past extra cover, ugly but it did the trick
slower ball heaved to deep square leg ... an absence of timing ...
slow and short, swatted into the leg side and deep square leg was put under pressure as they came back for two and he ran over the ball, allowing them back for a third
Shah cut in half as he tries to cut ... excellent start and he follows through with interest to emphasise the point
pushed to extra cover and a quick run
pulled to deep midwicket
Prior struggles and then exchanges a word or two with the bowler
he leans back and cuts in the air for a one-bounce four behind square
extra pace and although Shah aims to repeat the shot, it climbs too much
steered to third man
a step to leg and an agricultural heave. Ugly and utterly ineffective. The ball dribbles back to the bowler
turned off his legs, fine leg has 20 yards to scurry to his left and the batsmen take on the arm as well
turned to square leg, the batsmen were looking for two but the man in the deep was sprinting in alert to that
banged in, pulled uppishly and it just has the legs to get over the rope. Had deep midwicket been  at square leg then it would have been right down his throat
dug in, Prior, who was on the walk, surprised and he has to nod it past
punched through the covers to the man in the deep
the ugly heave syndrome has now spread to Shah ... the ball goes nowhere
Shah steps so far to the off that when it hits him he is well outside the line, the ball spears off his pads into the on side
textbook yorker, Shah digs it out and a quick run as the ball trundles into the leg side
Prior heads to leg, so much so that he almost overbalances, a yorker-length ball just outside off leaves him looking very clumsy
angled to third man ... and he keeps the strike
angling down leg, Prior follows it round, driving out wide of mid-on
down leg again, Prior backs away and drives out to Albie Morkel wide of mid-on
waits for a short one outside off, and drops his hands at the last minute to play a back-foot ease down to third man
full toss down leg, tries to play it off the hips - absolute gimme left alone
low full toss and middle-and-leg, driven out to extra cover
right on the money outside off, but England pinch a single with a nibble in front of point off the back foot
outside off pulled left of midwicket where Kemp gets a hand on it
driven on the up short of long-on and they get back for two
that went high over midwicket - Shah standing tall and pinging it - golf swing crisp - from outside off deep into the midwicket crowd
wideish down off now, moving away a touch, Shah cuts unconvincingly over it
slower ball outside off, Shah backs away and is too far away to do anything other than steer straight to point
Shah cuts loose again, stepping down and depositing the ball, with an aerial drive wide of long-on
dragged it short and the slower ball cuts from outside off wide of leg, Prior already through the shot
squirted down to just inside the third-man boundary where it's tidied and returned
backs away, moves back across, and all before the ball has been delivered - when it is there's a crisp drive out to the man inside the cover fence
down leg and a wide is rightly signalled
outside off, Prior goes for the inside-out drive and sends the ball high and over to the deep cover who comes in to hold a fairly straightforward catch
spears in full, and the batsman just plants his bat there at the last minute, stunning the ball to the covers
squared up, Flintoff squirts a leading edge towards cover but it just falls short and he and England breathe again
stands tall and has what may be politely described as a heave, the inside edge driving towards fine leg - although he wanted it to go through cover
short and pulled in front of midwicket
drive on the up - lobbing mid-off in the process - but without the distance he was hoping for, and it plugs before finally making the rope
outside off, nipping a touch off the seam, the batsman offers a game jab away from his body, but is too late on it and lucky not to get the edge
walks out to meet the ball which pitches outside off, and drives to cover, calling "Yeahyeahyeah" as he goes. That will be a "yeah", then
big booming ... miss outside off with a huge fresh-air drive to a wide one down off
outside off and has Philander just dropped the match? Flintoff cut away on the back foot firmly to him inside the cover boundary
audacious flick off the legs - very wristy shot, that one, whipping away behind square
cleaned him up with a straight one, Shah swinging away to midwicket with a forceful pull... but he missed
rising delivery, veering towards leg, turned off the hips to get off the mark - and they choose not to go for the second, though it was on
on leg, driven out to mid-on to bring up the hundred
outside off, the up-and-over towards deep third man, Snape deliberately opening the face to run it there
turned off the hips to a wide fine leg
down the track, and a thick inside edge is boomed off the back foot - as booming as inside edges get, of course - towards a straight long-on
cheers for the dot ball, a drive to cover
driven down the ground this time and a scramble for Flintoff to make his ground, but he does
slower ball, full, run down to deep third man
comes outside his crease down off to meet a fullish ball which he drives back out to mid-off for a comfortable single
short, straight and Flintoff backs away, giving himself room to cut off the back foot through the covers
slower delivery, clever, and catches out Snape who is through with the pull shot too early
full length on leg stump, knocked to mid-on
full length, driven inside the deep cover boundary where there are three marshalls keeping it out
terrific ball there, straight and nipping in, Flintoff backing away on the back foot and he was a deceived man
down the pitch and Flintoff comes across but can't connect, the ball rapping him on the leg just outside off. No appeal
short and Flintoff comes across from outside off and swivels round in trying to pull the ball square
backing away and tries a big whoosh, cutting right over the ball
down leg, misses it, and the ball veers just wide of leg
that's it for Snape; the pressure told after all, with a drive straight to cover
backs away and drives to backward point
digs out a yorker, wristing it to midwicket
short and flatbatted through mid-off
outside leg, Mascarenhas adjusts to drive to long-off for a harmless single
came right across again - a familiar effort from him this innings - and he's castled by a straight one, the ball taking the top of off
connects well with the drive backward of point
nipping back in at the left hander off the seam, swivelled to short midwicket
goes for the booming on-drive, but doesn't quite connect and they can only get a single
driven out inside the cover boundary
outside leg, huge inside edge evades short fine leg
down leg, a swing and a miss
full delivery, outside leg, Mascarenhas brings down his bat to dig the ball out towards gully
driven through cover to the man sweeping inside the cover boundary
low full toss and Mascarenhas can only drive one-handed to short midwicket
